alert.note: Alert for Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 13 at 12:20PM EST until January 13 at 7:27PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Maine, including the following counties, in south central Maine, Sagadahoc. In southwest Maine, Androscoggin and Cumberland. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1220 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Portland, Lewiston, Auburn, Brunswick, Westbrook, Mechanic Falls, Naples, Topsham, Cumberland and Gorham.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
